nodes.body:
### PR summary [2c2557b099](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18304/commits/2c2557b099b6fcd84bb83c62f0cc68358d4aea3f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
Does this change mean that we could also provide cache for the tests and replay them locally to see what failed?
I don't know the answer to this question: but if possible, that seems helpful -- and I think this could happen in a follow-up.
That would be great, indeed.
#18550 includes this in the mathlib cache (naturally, untested yet).

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11656185549/job/32451952438)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11656185549/job/32451952332)

CI passes now; the current changes look fine.

I just tried running `lake test` locally, with making a test fail - the output changes now, but in my opinion not for the worse. Having some tracking `[2640/5619] Running MathlibTest.cc` output is a bit weird (given that the number of tests is much smaller) - but having some progress indicator (as opposed to none before) is great.
I do think there is room to iterate on how to present these results, but that need not happen in this PR. So, let me
maintainer merge
Good plan to move tests to a separate library!

Thanks!
bors d+
I am not a big expert on `lakefile`s, but assuming this passes CI, I am happy with the changes!
Good plan to move tests to a separate library!
I am not a big expert on `lakefile`s, but assuming this passes CI, I am happy with the changes!

All the changes you made also look good to me. I saw adomani checked on things that might be missing (`test` directories in the code, linters being path-dependent) --- so, with these addressed and CI passing, I'm quite confident the code should work.
Thanks for doing this!

CI passes now; the current changes look fine.

I just tried running `lake test` locally, with making a test fail - the output changes now, but in my opinion not for the worse. Having some tracking `[2640/5619] Running MathlibTest.cc` output is a bit weird (given that the number of tests is much smaller) - but having some progress indicator (as opposed to none before) is great.
I do think there is room to iterate on how to present these results, but that need not happen in this PR. So, let me
maintainer merge

Thanks!
bors d+
I've removed this (now broken) test on @adomani's [advice](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Making.20Mathlib.20tests.20into.20a.20library/near/479175338).

```suggestion
```
This is just copy-paste, right?
Would you like to add the corresponding `end` statement? Not required.
Would you like to add the corresponding `end` statement? Not required.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: make tests into a library

### PR summary [2c2557b099](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18304/commits/2c2557b099b6fcd84bb83c62f0cc68358d4aea3f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Good plan to move tests to a separate library!
I am not a big expert on `lakefile`s, but assuming this passes CI, I am happy with the changes!

All the changes you made also look good to me. I saw adomani checked on things that might be missing (`test` directories in the code, linters being path-dependent) --- so, with these addressed and CI passing, I'm quite confident the code should work.
Thanks for doing this!

CI passes now; the current changes look fine.

I just tried running `lake test` locally, with making a test fail - the output changes now, but in my opinion not for the worse. Having some tracking `[2640/5619] Running MathlibTest.cc` output is a bit weird (given that the number of tests is much smaller) - but having some progress indicator (as opposed to none before) is great.
I do think there is room to iterate on how to present these results, but that need not happen in this PR. So, let me
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
Does this change mean that we could also provide cache for the tests and replay them locally to see what failed?
I don't know the answer to this question: but if possible, that seems helpful -- and I think this could happen in a follow-up.
That would be great, indeed.

source.title: feat(Cache): include MathlibTest in the cache
